snippet: Less than two weeks after its diplomats meet on Monday with those of six major powers in Moscow, Iran faces a potentially crippling oil embargo and banking sanctions.
abstract: Iran faces the imposition of a potentially crippling European oil embargo and American banking sanctions, less than two weeks after its diplomats meet with those of the United States and five other major powers in Moscow; it is the first of these sessions to be held in one of the negotiating countries, and it comes at a time when Russia, facing international opprobrium because of its ties to the brutal government in Syria, could use a diplomatic victory.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Ellen Barry from Moscow. Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Less than two weeks after its diplomats meet on Monday with those of six major powers in Moscow, Iran faces a potentially crippling oil embargo and banking sanctions.

headline.seo: Iran Faces Critical Choice in New Round of Nuclear Talks
headline.main: In Moscow, Iran to Face Critical Choice in the Latest Round of Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: In Moscow, Iran to Face Critical Choice in the Latest Round of Nuclear Talks
